BR_text.BRsummary: Can not get PhysXArticulations20201 branch working
BR_text.BRdescription:
I am experimenting with the new PhysX Articulations in Unity 2020.1 - when I pull the PhysXArticulations20201 branch and run, I get the following error:
 <denchmark-code>Assembly 'Assets/ML-Agents/Plugins/ProtoBuffer/Grpc.Core.dll' will not be loaded due to errors:
 Grpc.Core references strong named System.Interactive.Async, versions has to match. Assembly references: 3.0.1000.0 Found in project: 3.0.3000.0.
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Unity v 2020.1.0a16
 FYI <denchmark-link:https://github.com/VilmantasBal>@VilmantasBal</denchmark-link>

comments_0.comment_text:
As a temp HACK - replacing System.Interactive.Async with v3.0.1 seems to work:
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents/files/3991729/System.Interactive.Async.dll.zip>System.Interactive.Async.dll.zip</denchmark-link>

comments_1.comment_text:
Same in 2020.1.0a17, tried adding the following the the csproj file without any luck:
 <denchmark-code>  <dependentAssembly>
     <assemblyIdentity name="System.Interactive.Async" publicKeyToken="94bc3704cddfc263" culture="neutral" />
     <bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-3.0.3000.0" newVersion="3.0.1000.0" />
   </dependentAssembly>
 </denchmark-code>
 
 however <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Sohojoe>@Sohojoe</denchmark-link>
  dll replacement file does the trick
  (17.March.20): using mlagents 0.14.1 + unity 2020.1.0b1 yields the same error - the dll above fixed that as well <denchmark-link:https://github.com/surfnerd>@surfnerd</denchmark-link>

comments_2.comment_text:
We've updated the System.Interactive.Async assembly to resolve this issue.  The fix was merged to master in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents/pull/3512>#3512</denchmark-link>
  and will be in the next release.
